statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: MaCio Teague and Ahmad Thomas combined to score 37 points to help power UNC Asheville past Wofford, 85-65 Sunday afternoon for its 12th straight home court victory.
article.headline: Teague, Thomas lead UNC Asheville past Wofford, 85-65
article.linkText: Teague, Thomas lead UNC Asheville past Wofford, 85-65
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. -- MaCio Teague and Ahmad Thomas combined to score 37 points to help power UNC Asheville past Wofford, 85-65 Sunday afternoon for its 12th straight home court victory. The Bulldogs now are 71-16 all-time at Kimmel Arena, 48-10 in Big South Conference contests. Thomas picked up a pair of steals for UNC Asheville (4-2), making him just the sixth player in conference history to amass more than 1,000 career points, 500 career rebounds and 200 career steals. Teague knocked down 6 of 12 attempts from the floor and 5 of his 7 shots from behind the three-point arc to finish with 19 points to go with eight assists. Thomas added 18 points. Fletcher Magee finished with 20 points to lead Wofford (3-4) , with Nathan Hoover contributing 18 points. The game was the 25th meeting between the schools, but the first since the 2009-10 season. The Bulldogs are 17-8 all-time in the series.
